alert.note: Alert for Grayson (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 13 at 7:52AM CST until December 13 at 5:00PM CST by NWS Dallas-Fort Worth
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM CST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of north central Texas, including the following counties, Cooke and Grayson. * WHEN...Until 1000 AM CST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Emergency management reported heavy rain in the advisory area due to thunderstorms causing urban and small stream flooding. Low lying and/or poor drainage areas will experience minor flooding in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Gainesville, Whitesboro, Pottsboro, Collinsville, Lindsay, Callisburg, Lake Kiowa, Hubert H Moss Lake, Lake Texoma, Road Runner, Valley View, Sadler, Oak Ridge, Walnut Bend, Leo, Woodbine, Sturgeon, Burns, Dixie and Dexter.
info.instruction: Do not drive through flooded roadways.
